intro: Cyrtomium shandongense, commonly known as the Shandong holly fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to eastern China. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its leathery, dark green fronds that are divided into lance-shaped pinnae. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, and it is valued for its ornamental appearance in horticulture. Cyrtomium shandongense is also notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
